name: Moroccan Mint Tea
ingredients: Two teaspoons of Gunpowder green tea
4 to 6 sugar cubes (or more/less, to taste)
steps: Bring the water to a boil (or simmer at 70-80Â°C).
Place the green tea at the bottom of a teapot, and rinse it by sprinkling it with boiling water. Discard this water (this step 'cleans' the tea).
Add the fresh mint (and wormwood, if used), then the sugar. Cover with boiling water.
Let it steep for 1 to 2 minutes. Pour the tea into a glass, then pour the contents of the glass back into the teapot. Repeat this operation several times to mix well and 'break' the tea.
Enjoy when the infusion takes on a beautiful golden color, serving from a height to aerate.
